summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection record showing Jeffrey Epstein's passport information, including issuance on March 8, 2019, with an expiration date of March 7, 2029. The document was generated on April 26, 2019, and is marked as For Official Use Only/Law Enforcement Sensitive.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the passport record, showing his personal information and passport issuance details.

events.title: Epstein passport issued
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's U.S. passport was issued by the United States.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein obtained a new U.S. passport on March 8, 2019, approximately four months before his arrest in July 2019.
The passport was valid for 10 years, with an expiration date of March 7, 2029.
The document was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 26, 2019, and is marked as For Official Use Only/Law Enforcement Sensitive.
This passport issuance occurred while Epstein was a registered sex offender and under investigation for sex trafficking.
The document confirms Epstein's U.S. nationality and provides his date of birth and gender.
